solution_line_template: First, we need to determine the profit per book. To do this, we perform {selling_price_per_book}-{cost_per_book}=<<{selling_price_per_book}-{cost_per_book}={profit_per_book}>>{profit_per_book} dollars in profit per book.
Next, we divide the total sales by the profit per book, performing {total_profit}/{profit_per_book}=<<{total_profit}/{profit_per_book}={total_books_sold}>>{total_books_sold} books sold in total.

Since the books are sold {books_per_customer} at a time, we divide the number sold by {books_per_customer} to find the total number of people sold to, performing {total_books_sold}/{books_per_customer}=<<{total_books_sold}/{books_per_customer}={total_customers}>>{total_customers} people in total.
